Recipe.title: Deadly Rolls
Recipe.Source: From the Kitchen of Sheryl VanOrman
Recipe.Description:
These rolls are the lightest, fluffiest rolls we have ever eaten! They are also easy to mix up as they are made of only basic ingredients.
But the best thing about these rolls is the mixing can be done days ahead of the cooking. Since there is extra sugar, the yeast will stay alive and partially dormant if the dough is refrigerated. That means one less thing you have to do on the day of a big meal, but you still get fresh rolls.

section.title: Preparing Dough
section.instruction:
In a mixing bowl, mix Sugar, Water and Yeast.
(Water must be about body temperature. To the touch, this will feel slightly warmer than room temperature, but not hot.)
After a few minutes, when yeast begins to foam, add the rest of the ingredients, except for the butter, and knead for 10 minutes.
Put into a greased bowl, roll around and turn over once so top is greased. Then cover bowl with plastic wrap.

section.title: Baking
section.instruction: Punch down Dough and shape into 12 pieces.
Melt butter in a small bowl.
Shape each piece of dough by flattening slightly, then folding the edges down and under until you have a ball with a smooth top. (Bottom will not be smooth.)
Roll each ball in melted butter and place, bottom down, into a muffin tin.

Notes.note: It is easiest to mix this up the day before you need it and let it refrigerate overnight.
The Dough can be kept in fridge for up to 3 days if it is punched down two or three times a day until you use it.

Modifications.modification: To make slightly fancier rolls: In Baking Step 2, shape into 24 pieces, then in Baking Step 5 place 2 in each pocket of the muffin tin.
To make dinner rolls: In Baking Step 2, shape into 15 pieces, then in Baking Step 5 place them in 3 rows of 5 on a small cookie sheet with 1&inch; spacing.
